content: Ken Nakagaki's Web Ken NakagakiAboutFull PortfolioPublicationAwards & ExhibitionsNewsAxLab Web Ken NakagakiInteraction Designer / HCI Researcher @UChicago CS 'Actuated Experience'I invent and speculate on the gap between our fingertips and the physical world, with means of physical computing, robotics, and HCI (Human-Computer Interaction) research. I investigate the future of the physical environment and materials coupled with computation for novel tangible and embodied experiences. Currently, as an assistant professor at the University of Chicago, I direct Actuated Experience Lab - AxLab, where we invent and design the future User Experience based on actuated User Interface technology that shape-change and physic reconfigures. *Please visit axlab.info for the latest projects and news from my lab. Please check AxLab's Twitter and Instagram as well!​ Research SummaryPresentation Originally created for MIT Technology Review's Innovators Under 35 Japan Award Ceremony. *Japanese Version: こちら Selected Research*THE LIST IS NOT UPDATED AFTER 2022.
